transportAdvice: Rishikesh's main ghats and market areas are walkable, though the town is spread out and auto-rickshaws or shared jeeps are the most practical way to move between neighborhoods; taxis are widely available for day trips to nearby attractions. No metro or formal bus network serves the tourist core, but state bus services connect Rishikesh to major regional cities.

weather.description: Cool, clear winter days with chilly nights; comfortable for sightseeing and yoga retreats.
Mild and pleasant with occasional light showers; one of the more comfortable months to visit.
Warming spring weather with clear skies; ideal conditions for outdoor activities and trekking.
Hot and dry with increasing temperatures; mornings are still pleasant for river activities.
Very hot with pre-monsoon humidity building; early mornings are the best time to be outdoors.
Monsoon arrives bringing heavy rainfall; river levels rise significantly and white-water rafting is suspended.
Peak monsoon with frequent heavy rain and risk of landslides on mountain roads; many adventure activities are closed.
Continued heavy monsoon rains; the Ganges runs high and fast, limiting riverside access.
Monsoon begins to ease late in the month but rain remains frequent; lush green landscapes emerge.
Post-monsoon cooling with mostly clear skies; an excellent month for trekking and rafting as rivers settle.
Cool and dry with crisp air; one of the best months to visit for comfortable temperatures and clear views.
Cold winter sets in, especially at night; peaceful atmosphere with fewer crowds and clear mountain air.
